page.title: 08Schools.
page.content: There has been a school in Whitchurch for over 150 years.The present Primary School which was opened in 1973 has just over 350 children and 10 classes,although in September there will be 11.The present headmaster is Mr.E.J.Weller. There are 5 lower school classes and five upper school classes.The school day begins at 9 o'clock and ends at 3.40p.m.There is a dinner break from 12 o'clock until 1.15p.m. There is a school kitchen where school meals are cooked for the children although most of the children now bring sandwiches for their school meal. At the age of eleven the children transfer to the Comprehensive School called Testbourne which takes children from many Primary schools in the area.
